definition: to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
machine/engine/opportunity/intention/aircraft/pivot/crucial point/flexible (quick-witted)/organic/CL:臺|台[tai2]
surname Ji
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
opportunely/coincidentally/as it happens/skillful/timely

sentences.english: This led to corner cutting and-with surprising frequency-falsification of data.
sentences.chinese: 其结果导致投机取巧了，伪造数据资料，其。

sentences.english: Besides, change according to changing circumstances and fluke mind exists in the majority of people.
sentences.chinese: 此外，投机取巧和侥幸心理大多数人都有这种心理。

sentences.english: A gimmicky or imbalanced team relies on one powerful tactic to win.
sentences.chinese: 投机取巧的团队依靠单一的强力战术制胜。

sentences.english: He wants no members in his political party who are lust along for the ride.
sentences.chinese: 他不想让投机取巧者在他的政党里。

definition: to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
quick fix/opportune short cut (around a difficulty)/cheap trick (to get what one wants)/to pull a fast one
dishonest practices
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
to reap without sowing (idiom)
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
to think oneself clever (idiom)
lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to swindle/to cheat
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to resort to tricks/to act in a slippery way/to try to evade (work, responsibility)
